p: GC/MS analysis of the plant essential oil led to the identification and quantification of 5 components, which accounted for 99.9% of the total oil ( Table 1). The major components of the oil were carvacrol (52.5%) and linalool (45.4%). The essential oil consisted mainly of oxygenated monoterpenes (98.2%), whereas monoterpene hydrocarbons were weakly represented (1.7%). A portion (0.1%) of the total composition was not identified. Terpinen-4-ol was found as a main component in Origanum majorana essential oil which was from Kalocsa, Hungary. Linalool was also found as a component (12.1%) but carvacrol was not found ( 27).
